page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES:POPULATION
page.content: The indigenous people in our area are desended from the Scandinavians and the Mainland Scots who have settled in our area over the centuries. Before the "employment boom" of the mid 1970s the population was in decline, many young people left Sumburgh and Shetland to seek jobs. When the airport was expanded to meet the demands of the North Sea Oil Industry many jobs were available. People were attracted from all over Shetland, Scotland and England. However due to long range helicopters the traffic at the airport has decreased and the number of people employed and living in the area has fallen. The population stands at about 300 people.
